questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Which three items represent features of VM-FEX with Cisco Nexus 1000V? (Choose three.)

comments.content: that's what vm fex does indeed, but the nexus is a software one so i think it is ADE
I'm sorry, you are right, the vm fex is going to pass through even the 1000v
I'd say it's "hardware switching". FEX by definition doesn't "swtich packets" - it forwards it to the FI or Nexus

questions.question_text:
You are planning the compute capacity to allocate virtualized servers. Which three application characteristics should you use to calculate the required capacity?
(Choose three.)

choices.F: the memory resources consumed by the application
choices.E: the network bandwidth consumed by the applications
choices.B: the number of server NICs used by the applications
choices.D: the advanced CPU features used by the applications
choices.A: the type of database used by the applications
choices.G: the CPU resources consumed by the application
choices.C: the amount of data stored by the applications

discussion.content:
Correct answer: AC
You can partition a single ASA into multiple virtual devices, known as security contexts. Each context acts as an independent device, with its own security policy, interfaces and administrators.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa97/configuration/general/asa-97-general-config/ha-contexts.pdf

questions.question_text: Which two functionalities are provided for each context by using multiple context mode on a Cisco ASA firewall? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Correct answer: B
First of all the fabric login estabilishes a session between an N-port and a corresponding F-port. The fabric login (FLOGI) takes place after the initialization of the link and is an absolute prerequisite for the exchange of further frames.

questions.question_text: Which action must occur before an N Port can exchange data with other N Ports?

choices.C: The F Port must log in to its target N Port.
choices.A: The N Port must log in to its target F Port.
choices.B: The N Port must log in to its attached F Port.
choices.D: The F Port must log in to its attached F Port.

questions.question_text:
Scenario -
Review topology and screenshots, and then answer questions that validate your knowledge of Cisco Nexus Switches.
//IMG//


Instructions -
To access the multiple-choice questions, click on the numbered boxes on the left of the top panel.
Review the Exhibit associated with the question.
There are four multiple-choice questions with this task.
Be sure to answer all four questions before selecting the Next button
//IMG//

//IMG//

Refer to the figure in Exhibit 3. You have configured both pairs of Cisco Nexus 7000 Switches for OTV redundancy between data centers. Which of the following
OTV configuration elements will prevent the Overlay interface from forwarding traffic if it is not configured?

discussion.content:
Answer is : C
http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/nx-os/OTV/config_guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_7000_Series_NX-OS_OTV_Configuration_Guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_7000_Series_NX-OS_OTV_Configuration_Guide_chapter_011.html#task_12F938CA9F6F41D09E595DA784A33A7A

Ensure the site identifier is configured and is the same for all edge devices on a site. OTV brings down all overlays when a mismatched site identifier is detected from a neighbor edge device and generates a system message.
